1.「おいおい 何 言ってんだ。| この道標の目標は もうクリアしてるぞ？|<end: Hey, hey, what are you... We've already|cleared the target on this beacon, okay?<end>

2.「おお！| この目標は クリアしたんだな！| さすが <pc>！ やるじゃねえか: Oh! I see you've cleared this target! That's|what I'm talking about.<pc> Oh, my God! That's what I'm talking about!|All right, let's get you paid.<end>

4.「……んー？ なんか おかしいな。| ちょっと 問題が 起きてるみたいなんで|: ... Hmm? Something's wrong... There seems to|be a little problem, so I'm sorry, but I'll|come back in a while...|

5.「極致への道標について 何が知りたいんだ？|<break>: What do you want to know about the signpost|to extremis?<break>

6.「極致への道標ってのは| 冒険者を 強さの極致へと導くためのモンだ。|<br>|:
The Signposts of Perfection are meant to|guide the adventurer to the ultimate in|strength. When the adventurer has achieved|
|one goal, the signpost will point him to the|next. Repetition will eventually lead you to|the ultimate... It was once part of a skill|
|master's training... It was lost to the ages,|but now I've recreated it in my own way. What|do you think?|
Maybe you've been wanting to see the|ultimate, huh? It might be a little tough,|but I'll lead you right to it... Anyway, give|
|it a try!

7.「具体的には 俺に話しかけたときの| <pc>の つよさが| 道標の目標以上なら:
Specifically, when you spoke to me| If the strength of the target is greater than|the target of the signpost, then yes... In|that condition, if you select the signpost|
|and report back to me, you will receive the|prize... And you're ready to take on the next|challenge... I've got little rewards for you,|
|and even higher ranks for you, so keep|trying! And if you ever need to check your|goals when I'm not around, you can use the|
|signpost memo from the important ones...|There's also a function to write down the|contents, so you can use it if you want. But|
|only if you're in a safe place...

8.「極致への道標に 挑戦するんなら| 何をしたいか 俺に 言ってくれ！ |<br: If you're gonna challenge me to a signpost to|the extreme, you're gonna have to tell me|what you want!|

9.「この道標には まだ挑戦できないぜ。| 順番に 挑戦可能になるから| まずは挑戦:
These guideposts have yet to be challenged...|They'll be available in order of challenge,|so first, you need to complete the target|
|you're trying to reach...

12.「おお すげぇな！| この目標 クリアしちまったのか。| じゃあ この報酬を……:
Oh, my God! I'm gonna clear this target.|Okay, here's your reward. Oh, my God. You|have so much stuff. I'm gonna go get my stuff|
|together, and then we'll come back...

47.「今までに示された道標は 全部クリアしてるな。| 新たな目標が 見つかるまで|:
We've cleared all the milestones that have|been presented to us... Until we find a new|target, all we can do is check the status...|
|I'm sure the next marker will appear soon, so|just be patient...

51.「道標が示す目標は ひとつだけじゃなく| 最大ＨＰ と 攻撃力| みたいなやつも:
There's more than just one target on the|signposts, there's also things like maximum|HP and attack power... I know it's a bit of a|
|hassle, but in that case, just make sure both|of your strengths are above the target and|report back to me. I've been told that in|
|order to reach the ultimate, you need to|acquire a variety of strengths. It could be|an endless challenge...|

53.「道標が示す目標は あくまで| 冒険者自身の 本来のつよさと| 愛用してる装備で:
The guideposts indicate goals that must be|surpassed by the adventurer's own natural|strength and the equipment he uses. I'm|
|willing to accept strength changes that|disappear after a certain amount of time,|like the effects of eating food... If you're|
|a little short of your goal, you might want|to rethink the alchemy effect, or try|combining accessories...|

55.「よう <pc>。| いいところに 来てくれたぜ！|<br>|「ちょっとした 修:
be exalted .|You've come to the right|place! Why don't you join me for a little|training? It's called the Marker of|
|Perfection, and it's designed to lead|adventurers to the pinnacle of strength. Let|me explain it to you in simple terms. First,|
|I'm going to show you a list of the|guideposts to mastery... And... If your current strength is greater than the|target indicated by the signpost, then you|will be cleared.|
But once you've achieved one goal, the|guideposts point you to the next one. And if|you do it over and over again, eventually you|
|will reach the ultimate... How's that? Maybe you'd like to see something extreme.

57.「そんじゃ いつでも 目標を確認できるように| コイツを 渡しておくからよ。|<: Well, I'll give you this so you can always|see the target...<end>

59.「ソイツを見たいときは だいじなものから| 使ってくれれば オッケーだ。|<br:
If you want to see it, just start with the|most important one. If you want to know more,|just select "Ask for instructions." I'll give|
|you a lecture any time. All right, let's get|this over with.
